prompt: Real-time IoT telemetry pipeline with dashboards

services.name: Azure IoT Hub
services.description: Ingests real-time telemetry from IoT devices

services.name: Azure Stream Analytics
services.description: Performs real-time stream processing, aggregations, and routing

services.name: Azure Functions
services.description: Serverless processing for event-driven enrichment and alerts

services.name: App Service
services.description: Web application hosting dashboards and API endpoints

services.name: SQL Database
services.description: Hot-path operational store for recent telemetry and aggregates

services.name: Azure Data Lake Storage
services.description: Cold-path storage for historical telemetry and batch analytics

services.name: Power BI Embedded
services.description: Interactive dashboards and visualizations embedded into the web app

services.name: Microsoft Entra ID
services.description: User authentication and access control for dashboards and APIs

services.name: Key Vault
services.description: Secure storage for connection strings, API keys, and secrets

services.name: Azure Monitor
services.description: Central monitoring for application performance and health

services.name: Log Analytics
services.description: Central log and metric analytics workspace

connections.label: Forward real-time device telemetry streams for processing
Trigger serverless processing on device events and alerts
Write aggregated real-time metrics into hot-path database
Persist raw and windowed telemetry to data lake for historical analysis
Store enriched device events and computed KPIs
Query latest telemetry and aggregates for dashboards
Embed interactive Power BI reports into web dashboard
Retrieve telemetry datasets and aggregates for report visuals
Authenticate dashboard users and obtain access tokens
Retrieve database and Power BI API credentials securely
Send application performance and availability telemetry
Aggregate logs and metrics for centralized analysis

workflow.description: IoT devices send real-time telemetry messages that are ingested by Azure IoT Hub.
Azure IoT Hub forwards telemetry streams to Azure Stream Analytics for real-time processing and aggregation.
In parallel, Azure IoT Hub triggers Azure Functions for event-driven enrichment, alerting, or device state updates.
Azure Stream Analytics writes aggregated metrics and computed windows into SQL Database as the hot-path store.
Azure Stream Analytics also archives raw and windowed telemetry into Azure Data Lake Storage for long-term retention and offline analysis.
Azure Functions performs additional business logic and stores enriched device events or KPIs into SQL Database.
Users access the dashboard hosted on App Service, which authenticates them via Microsoft Entra ID before granting access.
The App Service backend securely retrieves connection strings and API keys from Key Vault to reach data and visualization services.
The dashboard in App Service queries SQL Database for latest telemetry and embeds interactive Power BI reports based on that data.
Azure Monitor collects performance and availability telemetry from App Service and forwards it to Log Analytics for centralized observability.

connections.label: Stream device telemetry events into real-time processing job
Persist raw telemetry stream for replay and long-term retention
Write processed telemetry and rolling aggregates for low-latency querying
Store enriched/curated stream outputs for historical analytics
Trigger change-feed processing for alerts and downstream actions
Upsert alert states, incident records, and enriched entities
Send cloud-to-device commands or update desired properties
Query near-real-time aggregates and status for dashboards
Authenticate users and issue tokens for embedded dashboard access
Validate client identity and authorize API calls for operational actions
Retrieve secrets/keys for downstream connections and signing operations
Emit application logs, custom metrics, and failure signals
Centralize logs and metrics for querying, alerting, and retention

workflow.description: Devices publish telemetry securely to the cloud ingestion endpoint.
Incoming telemetry is streamed into real-time processing for filtering, windowing, and anomaly detection.
Raw telemetry is durably persisted for replay, auditing, and long-term history.
Processed outputs and rolling aggregates are written to the operational store for low-latency queries.
Curated/enriched stream outputs are also stored in the data lake for historical analytics and batch exploration.
New/changed records trigger serverless logic to enrich events, calculate alert states, and persist operational entities.
When conditions are met, serverless logic issues cloud-to-device commands or desired property updates back to devices.
Authenticated users view near-real-time dashboards powered by operational aggregates while the app emits telemetry for monitoring and troubleshooting.

workflow.description: Devices send telemetry securely to the ingestion endpoint.
Incoming telemetry is captured to raw storage for replay and audit.
Stream analytics detects patterns and triggers enrichment logic.
Enriched telemetry is persisted for low-latency queries and archival.
Real-time aggregates are sent to embedded dashboards.
Dashboards retrieve historical context and receive live updates.
Processing metrics are monitored and stored for operational insights.

Consume telemetry partitions for real-time SQL-like stream processing

Write raw and enriched event batches for historical retention
Trigger serverless handlers when anomaly rules or thresholds match

workflow.description: Devices send telemetry to IoT ingress and events are routed into the streaming backbone.
Real-time analytics jobs read partitioned events and execute filtering, windowing, and anomaly logic.
Processed live aggregates are written to operational storage and cached for rapid dashboard reads.
Raw and enriched telemetry is archived to the data lake for long-term trend analysis.
Detected anomalies trigger serverless handlers, which securely pull secrets and persist alert records.
Alert outcomes and incident state are stored for dashboard and operations visibility.
Dashboard users authenticate through identity services before loading embedded analytics.
Dashboards query both hot telemetry store and cache to render near-real-time visuals.
Streaming compute emits health metrics to monitoring, then logs are centralized for diagnostics.

connections.label: Send telemetry via MQTT/AMQP
Route raw events to Event Hubs
Process streaming data
Write aggregated results
Archive raw data (optional)
Batch processing and ML
Query data for dashboards
Authenticate dashboard users

workflow.description: IoT devices send telemetry to IoT Hub using MQTT/AMQP.
IoT Hub routes raw telemetry to Event Hubs for high-throughput buffering.
Stream Analytics ingests events from Event Hubs, processes in real-time (aggregation, anomaly detection).
Processed data is written to Cosmos DB for low-latency dashboard queries.
Raw telemetry is optionally archived to Data Lake Storage for historical analysis.
Batch processing and machine learning jobs in Synapse Analytics read from Data Lake.
Power BI Embedded queries Cosmos DB to display real-time dashboards, with user authentication via Microsoft Entra ID.
All services send metrics and logs to Azure Monitor, which forwards to Log Analytics for storage and query.
